Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Have you seen Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's around here somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Mmm. [exits, Erin smiles deviously]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, Darryl's here. So is Santa Claus. It's just a regular Thursday. [checks for anyone around] Neither guy is here. And, it's Friday. Welcome to me and Darryl's world of lies.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Nobody knows it yet, but Darryl already started working in Philly. So now, he has to sneak out of here like the sneakiest little sneaky-sneak you ever saw. And I'm his helper. It's so fun.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [as Darryl descends stairs, Erin ascends carrying a giant teddy bear] Darryl. Meet... bear... ull.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: How much did you pay for that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Nothing. Won him at the carnival. Spent a ton on tickets, though. Drive safe.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Everybody knows I go to Philly. I've just been using sick days I saved up. But, Erin was so excited about being sneaky-sneaks, I went along with it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [exiting Darryl's office] Ha, ha, ha! Darryl, you are too much! [to Phyllis] That guy's hilarious. He's here today. [giant teddy bear is viewed in Darryl's office]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I've really been putting in the hours on this mural. And my boss is totally OK with it, because he's in the Bahamas and has no clue what anybody is doing. I'm usually very self-critical. I hate what I paint. But, I don't know, this time I feel like it's, um, it's really coming together... [sees mural] Oh my god! [camera pans to mural with butts painted over it] Wha? You've gotta be kidding me! What it... are those... are those butts? [to warehouse crew] Huh? No way. No way!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Excuse me, everyone. Is it OK if I leave early from work today? It's Phillip's first birthday and the senator and I are hosting a party at our house.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Aw, cute! So there'll be a bunch of kids.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. No children. Our house is not kid-friendly. Most of our furniture is sharp. Also, ew. It will mostly be campaign donors.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Angela, I am prepared to donate a whopping... [pulls cash from wallet] 8 dollars to Lipton For America to have an invitation...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, no, please. You know, actually, none of you could even really make the cut for this thing. Which I am so sad about.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [undertone] Angela. You're going to find out, so I thought I'd let you know that, uh, Robert invited me too.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He said he wanted me there for support.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm his! His... wife.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela's husband and I are in love. But, as a politician in this town, you still need the conventional blonde wife on your lawn signs. He is risking everything to have me there today. [laughs] Me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [on phone with Robert] We agreed that you wouldn't be seen with him in public. It's humiliating for me. Well, if you get to bring a stud, maybe I do too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [in Darryl and Jim's Philly apartment] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We are splitting a sublet on a place near Philly.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Just a couple of grown, sexy-ass roommates.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And, as much as I miss Pam and the kids, it's, uh, kinda nice to live the bachelor life again. You know, let your hair down.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Jim was nice enough to give me his bedroom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm couching it!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Which usually means there's clothes all over the living room.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And this dude labels his food. He's the clean one. And, I'm the messy one. How much fun is this?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I love Jim. I love that he hooked me up with a job. It's just, he uses old t-shirts as wash rags. He doesn't wash his dishes. Apparently, they need to [quote-unquote fingers] soak... He hooked me up with a job.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [ascends on lift, using megaphone] Attention, everyone. Can I have your attention, please? Yeah, I don't know everybody's name down here, but whoever did this will you please raise your hand. [no one replies] Hello? This is not over. OK? I will stay up here all day if I have to. Is that what you want? [descends on lift] Yeah, I will also come down if I want to. It's my choice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't demand justice often. I'm not like Angela, who calls a lawyer every time someone watches a YouTube video of animals doing it. But, someone should get fired over this, right? Val's no help. Andy's gone. Jim's out. I just feel like I'm on my own here. [boom microphone bumps her head, she smiles] I mean, OK, not completely on my own. But, in terms of people who can do something. Thank you, Brian.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. So, Wade wants to send people to the Sloan conference. We gotta compile a list of our target clients.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Already on it. I ordered them by their Google trend ranking so we know who to hit first.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to camera] Who is this guy? We are killing it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes sir. [notices Jim's using his coffee mug]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [entering office] Conference room. Everybody. Now!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't have the clearance to call a conference room meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, but David Wallace does. And he asked me to gather everyone to talk about stuff... That's gonna be revealed once we're in the conference room for the meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're telling me, David Wallace asked you to call a super secret, classified conference room meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go everyone. Super secret, classified conference room meeting, now!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to everyone in conference room] I have terrible news. Someone defaced my mural. They painted all over it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I thought that's what you were doing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, but this is different.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. They used worse paint than your paint?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think so, but they put paint where I didn't want paint. So...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I thought you wanted paint on the whole thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Different colored paint. I wanted different colored paint in the spots where they put their paint. So, it just is... OK, the point is, these warehouse guys are vandals. And, they need to be stopped.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, and somebody had the balls to put my phone number on the men's room wall. Which is so messed up. It's 6782 not 83.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Uh, 6783's also a good time. Less mileage.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam, what can be done?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. Thank you. Let's answer that question.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I was politely saying nothing can be done. I thought I was clear.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? Come on guys. We need to figure out who did this and punish them. This isn't just about me. This is about all of us. This is our mural. Don't you see? How much we worked on this? How much time and energy? We put our heart and soul into this thing.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: David Wallace called this meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure did. I was as surprised as you, but apparently, he is very passionate about public art.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [as everyone begin to leave] No, no. Come on, guys. Don't go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, I'll help you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You will?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If there's anything I hate worse than art, it's crime.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I am in too, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes, of course. I believe in you. I believe in your art. And I am bored.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was hoping for a righteous mob, and I ended up with Dwight and Nellie. But, they both have a mob mentality. And, I'm pretty sure Dwight has a pitchfork in his car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [enters quickly] You need my pitchfork?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [approaches Dwight as he leaves] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is it? I have vengeance to exact.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Exciting news. There's room for one more at my son's birthday event. And, I want you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah, I'm not interested.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What? Wait. The state transportation secretary will be there. You could sell your beet salt idea to the highway people.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If I get the deicing gig, it's not gonna be on merit. Not because I played politics. [exits]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey. So, a little birdie just told me that Dwight can't come to your son's birthday. So, do you want me to go with you?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: OK. I understand. I'll just stay here, then. Alone with the money.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Aw, crap.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in warehouse] I am handing out pieces of paper. On which, you will draw one human butt. What I do with said drawings, is no one's business but my own.

Quote.Speaker: Frank
Quote.Text: You're gonna to compare 'um to the butts up there. [gestures mural]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Incorrect. It is my fetish. Oh, also, sign them. My fetish is signed drawings of butts.

Quote.Speaker: Glenn
Quote.Text: I'm not drawing a butt.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: All right then, they're bottoms. Uh, we should ask you to do big, rounded Ws.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. Or nipplous breasts. Perhaps.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: OK, OK. I think it's time to get back to work. Come on, fellas. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or melons. Like cantaloups. With the halves are cut off. And then, just the bottom parts...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, this is getting us nowhere.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We need another approach. Um, we need to fine the weakest one and separate him from the group. [they notice Nate struggling with a box] Yeah. I think if we could get Nate alone, we could crack him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We just need a pretense to talk to him. We could tell him that his mother is dying. That usually works on him. [holds up phone] Nate. Your mother is dying. [Nate reacts with grief]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: See, I feel bad about that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's all right. It's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: So, she's gonna pull through again? [all nod] That's great. Can I talk to her?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. She needs her rest again.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Now listen. Now that we have got you here, let's talk about this mural business.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know who the vandal is. Now, I know a lot of these warehouse guys are your friends, but we've got chewing gum.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Gum's gotten mintier lately. Have you noticed? Like, some of it's just too minty. It's like they're literally trying to hurt...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [interrupting] Tell us who defaced the mural!

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: [points at Warehouse Worker Frank] He did it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: All right. You can go. Give him his gum.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's no gum. There never was any gum.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: [leaving] That's really rude.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [at Phillip's party] Opening with pub pastries? That's a bold play. They're saying, it's only gonna get better from here? Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [noticing a portrait of Angela on the wall] That painting is just... How can anyone that weighs less than a guinea hen be so terrifying?

Quote.Speaker: Party Announcer
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, Senator and Angela Lipton. [guests applaud]

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: Thanks, everybody. Thanks for coming. Phillip had no idea he was so popular.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [laughs] Oh, Robert, you're horrible. [to other guests] Simon, Maxine. [sarcastically] Who let you guys in here?

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: [points to Jim and Darryl] This is the team.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice job, man.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You too... Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [confused] What? [Darryl points at his thermos Jim has been using] Oh, man! I'm sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's cool. Reading's tricky sometimes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, um... Are you really mad about this?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's my go-to thermos. That's all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. It's your go-to therm. Oh, man. That's a bummer. I'm sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No big deal. No big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no. If it's a big deal, it's a big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nah, nah...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [as Jim empties thermos into trash] Nah, nah, nah. You don't have to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Honestly, I don't mind. [long, awkward pause until thermos is empty] Did you want me to wash it for you or...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't know. You gonna wash it? Or you gonna let it soak?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [after tense pause] OK. Here ya go. [roughly hands Darryl his thermos]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: So, Frank. Do you have any thoughts about what was done? By you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Nellie] Maybe, maybe I could, could get the ball rolling. [Nellie nods] Um, Frank? Hi. Pam. Um, I am so sorry if I've done anything to offend you. I'm sure it isn't easy for you guys to have an upstairs person coming down in your space. So. Truly. If, if, I apologize. But enough about me. Your turn.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [Warehouse Worker Frank remains silent, picks ear] You sort of deserve an apology here. Frank?

Quote.Speaker: Frank
Quote.Text: I'm sorry I didn't like your crappy doodles. I drew a butt. Big deal. Butts are funny.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I didn't think that butt was funny.

Quote.Speaker: Frank
Quote.Text: Well, maybe if you got the stick out of yours.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Frank
Quote.Text: You know what? You people can't fire me. So, screw you. [exits]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Whoa! Hey! That is not OK. What are you gonna do about that?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh... it... compliment...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: The first 'sorry' sounded sincere.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: There were two or three 'sorry's in there. [mumbles along with Nellie]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That sucked. He didn't apologize. There's no talking to that guy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, your little feelings party didn't work out? Huh? Who won the hugging contest? Oh, let me guess. Everyone tied for first.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We should just take him down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait. Are you saying...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm saying we should go scorched earth on that guy's face.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Normally, I find Pam to be a comforting, if unarousing, presence around the office. Like a well-watered fern. But, today, she has tapped into this vengeful, violent side. And I'm like, wow, Pam has kind of a good butt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He messed with something that was important to you. We need to mess with something that's important to him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A little eye for an eye action.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go all Hammurabi on this clown.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We need an infiltrator.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know just the man for the job. [looks at Clark]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Clark?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He even looks like a mole.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: One of his tee shots can wipe out a whole owl population.

Quote.Speaker: Party Guest
Quote.Text: You two seem very close.

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: Yes. We're good friends. Good friends.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: You know, I suppose that may ruffle a few feathers. For a long time, our party has turned it's back on the Hispanic people. Well, that is not who I am. [puts arms around Oscar] I am a friend of the Latino community. And if you ask me, it's time we bid bigotry hasta luego. [guests laugh] Now, does my embrace of Hispanics make me more electable? Given demographic trends? I don't know. And I don't care. What I care about is Oscar. [slaps Oscar's cheek] My friend. Mi amigo. Oscar. [guests applaud as he hugs Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Maybe I should be insulted that he only invited me here to be his token Mexican friend. But, he could of invited any number of Hispanics that he knows. His gardener, Rogelio. Or he could've invited... Rogelio. But, he chose me. Rogelio's Malaysian... The son of a bitch is Malaysian.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I usually watch TV during my lunch breaks. It's cool?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Totally.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [after Darryl eyes him drinking from a thermos] It's mine. Don't worry.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I didn't say anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't think you had to.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you might be going a little crazy with this labeling thing, man. I mean, you put your name on a five pound bag of flour. Are you honestly saying that if I needed flour I couldn't use that?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What you need flour for, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not the point.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What? You making bread?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not making bread.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What kind of bread you making? Pumpernickel?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Darryl, it doesn't matter. I think you know the point I'm trying to make.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right, I'm being a jerk. You got me this job. I should be grateful. I am, I just... you know, I get finicky about my stuff. That's all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's all good. Are we all good?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that cooler?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nothing. [pulls out a can of soda] It's mine. [Jim shakes his head] [after looking through DVR] What happened to my Tavis Smileys?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, crap. Were those yours?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [pulling Clark across the parking lot] I never want to see you working in the upstairs office again. Do you hear me?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, my only crime was loving the local sports teams and trying to be one of the guys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Silence. You'll now be working in the warehouse with the untouchables. Now, go make your hands rough with work.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: OK, boss. [quietly] Pam, you know this is ridiculous, right? Like you're smarter than this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shh, shh.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: This is never gonna work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shh. Remember your lines.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: What lines?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go move some paper!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Darryl on phone] Hey, you know that guy Frank who works in the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: He's not my hire, but I know who he is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK. What does he like? What's important to him? Does he have like a favorite pair of boots or a lunch box or...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What? Is he retiring? You getting him a gift or something?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, something like that.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I know he loves his pick up truck.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, great! [to Dwight] His truck!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Great. Get the plate number.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK. [to Darryl] Do you know the plate... never mind. Why would you know that? And why would I be asking that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So we know which truck to van...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey. While I got you on the phone, your husband's like a sloppy, homeless hobo. Can you fix that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I was kinda hoping you could. I gotta go. Bye. [to Dwight] Come on. [camera pans to Clark duct taped to a chair]

Quote.Speaker: Party Photographer
Quote.Text: Hold on a second. Uh, Sandeep? Let's get you closer to the senator. Just about there. Great. And, Oscar? I'm gonna need you to step a little closer to the senator, as well. Somewhere there.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He's blocking me.

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: It's only a photo, honey.

Quote.Speaker: Party Photographer
Quote.Text: [to party waiter] Excuse me, uh, what's your name?

Quote.Speaker: Party Waiter
Quote.Text: Sean.

Quote.Speaker: Party Photographer
Quote.Text: LaShawn. Great. You wanna be in a photo? Right this way. [notices overweight man following] Not you. No.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He put me here.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He put you right in front of me?

Quote.Speaker: Party Photographer
Quote.Text: Let's just wheel Margaret right in front...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ow! Robert?!

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Party Photographer
Quote.Text: Smile. [Angela attempts to get in front of Oscar as pictures are taken]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm done. What are you... Is that supposed to be my mural?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. Frank draws a butt on your mural, I'm drawing your mural on Frank's truck's butt. Eye for an eye, mamacita.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aw, Dwight. That's really sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's see yours.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Um, I, I'm embarrassed. It's stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is amazing! Frank! And he's leaving a trail of poops?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. And he has saggy boobs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I saw that. That's great!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I feel better.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. I'm glad you feel better. This has been a wonderful day. I have to say, I like hanging out with a vengeful bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. You miss Angela, don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ugh! Don't sympathize. You're ruining the mood. Back to work. Draw his penis.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I got back at Frank in the most fitting way possible. With my art. The paints are water-based. It's gonna come off with a hose. But, I think the lesson will last a very...

Quote.Speaker: Frank
Quote.Text: [exiting building and approaching Pam] Lady! My truck? You had no right!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, you had no right!

Quote.Speaker: Frank
Quote.Text: It's a $40,000 truck!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So? You started it!

Quote.Speaker: Frank
Quote.Text: So? So someone need to shut you up! [attempts to attack Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey! [knocks Frank down with boom microphone]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: [as Frank gets up] Easy! [Frank grabs him]

Quote.Speaker: Frank
Quote.Text: You son of a bitch!

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: You're gonna hit a woman?

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: Thanks so much for coming. Thanks so much. [to Oscar and Angela] Well. Have we all calmed down yet?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes. Sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It was all my fault.

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: Let's all try to do better next time. Kevin, great to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Thank you for the food. Oh, and also, you suck.

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: I beg your pardon.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You are like a terrible person. These guys care about you and you're just using them. Again, the food was very good. [Oscar and Angela exit looking pleased]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I'm gonna say something to the producers.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: No. No, it's...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You shouldn't be fired. I mean, you were just protecting me.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: It's all good. I knew what I was doing. It's... I'm sorry about your mural, though. I mean, because you put so much into that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Forget about my mural. It's stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: No. You, you worked hard on that. That guy's an animal. I'm glad they're firing him too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's crazy. Brian, I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Look. I don't, I don't wanna put myself where I don't belong. If you ever need me, you just call me. And I'll be there for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks, Brian.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Seeya.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. This whole Philly thing has been so much fun that I may have lost sight of what really matters. I mean, having fun is not nearly as important as being good to the people who you really care about. I mean, that's just 'Roommates 101'.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [playing video game with Jim] Oh. Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Damn!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [imitating game announcer] You win. [Darryl throws empty can on floor] How good did that feel?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That felt really good, actually.
